name: Ragi Dosa
history: Ragi Dosa is a variation of the traditional South Indian dosa. It incorporates ragi flour, also known as finger millet, which is highly nutritious and popular in Southern India.
description: Ragi Dosa is a healthy and delicious alternative to the traditional dosa, made using ragi flour. It's rich in fiber and iron, making it a preferred choice for health-conscious individuals.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: Used for preparing the dosa batter.

equipment.name: ladle
equipment.description: Used for pouring the batter onto the skillet.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: Used for flipping and removing the dosa.

ingredients.quantity: as required to make a batter

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine ragi flour, rice flour, yogurt, and water to make a batter of pouring consistency. Let it rest for 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Add Flavors
instructions.description: Mix in the chopped onions, green chili, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, and salt into the batter.

instructions.title: Cook the Ragi Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it evenly to form a thin pancake. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa is golden brown. Flip and cook the other side.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Ragi Dosa hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

tips: The batter consistency is important for a crispy dosa. Adjust the water as needed.
Cook on a medium flame to ensure even cooking without burning.
variations: Add grated vegetables like carrots for extra nutrition.
For a different flavor, add a pinch of asafoetida (hing) to the batter.

storage.shelfLife: The batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat the dosa on a skillet until crisp.
presentationTips: Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves for a fresh look.
